free_text.Learning outcomes: Cover basic theoretical and experimental principles of solid-state NMR spectroscopy.
free_text.Content: Introduction to solid-state NMR spectroscopy. Spin tensor operators. Basic principles of Magic Angle Spinning (MAS) solid-state NMR. NMR of quadrupolar nuclei. Chemical shift anistropy (CSA) and dipolar recoupling/decoupling in solids. Modern applications to study of molecular structures and dynamics.
free_text.Keywords: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR), Solid-state NMR, Magic Angle Spinning (MAS)
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Either "Résonance Magntéique Nucléaire" (Bachelor course, Prof. Bodenhausen) or "Basic and Advanced NMR" (Doctoral course)
